intro: Guatteria pittieri, commonly known as the Mexican wax apple, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to Mexico and Central America, typically growing in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers that develop into edible, fleshy fruits. The fruit has a distinctive wax-like coating, which gives it its common name. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and as a source of edible fruit in local markets.
